abstract: The Federal Communications Commission can require cellphone companies to let customers of other carriers use their signals when outside their home territories.
snippet: The Federal Communications Commission can require cellphone companies to let customers of other carriers use their signals when outside their home territories.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Cellphone companies must allow customers of competing wireless carriers to use their networks for the Internet and e-mail when outside their home territory, a federal appeals court said here on Tuesday.

headline.main: Court Upholds F.C.C. Rule on Use of Data Networks
headline.print_headline: Court Upholds F.C.C. Rule On Use of Data Networks
